result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael Nelson Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Nelson Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: JOC corrected to make costs DOC collect.

Defendant Michael Nelson in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by parties.  

As to Count 2:  Defendant ordered to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit of 89 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation with the Mental Health Unit for 18 months.

As to Count 3:  Defendant ordered to serve 90 days in the House of Correction, to be served FORTHWITH.

Conditions of Probation:  
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Maintain absolute sobriety.  No illegal drugs.
*Anger management course.
*Make diligent efforts to seek and maintain full-time employment and/or school.
*No contact with Stacy J. and children. 
*Defendant to pay all costs, fees and surcharges during term of probation or civil judgment.

Court will consider motion for expungement upon successful completion of probation.  

filed: Pretrial Incarceration Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Received and Filed, Crime Victim Impact Statement.
TOT to Justice Point with all other conditions remaining.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $2,000.00 signature bond.

Defendant Michael Nelson in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Michael Nelson in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Parties have reached a resolution. 

AS TO COUNT 1
Pursuant to plea negotiations, on motion of the state, court ordered count 1 Dismissed, But Read In.

AS TO COUNTS  AND 3
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.    Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court via telephone.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Due to defense unavailability, case adjourned to 10/22/2015 at 8:30 am.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
No reply from defendant or surety.
